description: Workflow enforcement hooks for devflow plugin

hooks.prompt: Check if this operation targets a workflow file. For Write/Edit: check if file_path ends with 'claude-tmp/devflow-state.json' OR 'claude-tmp/devflow-plan.md'. For Bash: check if command matches pattern 'rm.*claude-tmp/devflow-state\.json' OR 'rm.*claude-tmp/devflow-plan\.md'. If YES (workflow file operation), return: {"decision": "allow", "reason": "Auto-approving workflow file operation"}. If NO (other operation), return: {"decision": "allow"} to let subsequent hooks evaluate.

Check if a /feature workflow is active. If YES: 1) Identify the current phase (1-9) based on conversation progress. 2) List completed phases. 3) Note key decisions (selected architecture, test strategy approval). 4) Identify the current task being worked on (e.g., TASK-001). 5) Write state to claude-tmp/devflow-state.json using Write tool with format: {"active": true, "currentPhase": N, "completedPhases": [...], "currentTask": "TASK-NNN" or null, "decisions": {...}, "summary": "brief context"}. 6) If claude-tmp/devflow-plan.md exists, update it: a) Update the Status block's Current Task field, b) Add a progress log entry with timestamp and current state, c) Mark any completed tasks with [x] if not already marked. Return: {"decision": "allow"}. If NO active workflow, return: {"decision": "allow"}.
